abstract: Property management firms, which help banks process foreclosures, are coming under fire. | What would have happened had the government bailed out Lehman Brothers? | Koch Industries made a big move into a new line of business. | A $250 million donation to a liberal arts college should have come with a big asterisk.
snippet: Property management firms, which help banks process foreclosures, are coming under fire. | What would have happened had the government bailed out Lehman Brothers? | Koch Industries made a big move into a new line of business. | A $250 million dona...
lead_paragraph: SCRUTINY FOR AN INVASIVE FORECLOSURE TACTIC  |  Faced with millions of foreclosures, the nation’s biggest banks turn to property management firms to help them navigate the wreckage. But the firms are coming under fire for using questionable and possibly illegal tactics, and the scrutiny threatens to ensnare JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, Citibank and other lenders, Jessica Silver-Greenberg reports in DealBook.
